page_analysis.text_content:
2nd & 3rd floor equivalency
Areas higher than 17' and 26' above the first floor (that do not already count as floor area e.g., open atrium
spaces and inaccessible attic spaces), count toward the gross floor area in the form of 2nd and 3rd floor equiva-
lency regardless of the floor plan or usage of the space. Stairwells will be measured the same way that vaulted
ceiling spaces are measured.
In the examples of Fig 12 below the highlighted areas count as follows:
Area A
• once as 1st floor,
• again as 2nd floor, and
• a third time as 3rd-floor equivalency
Area B
• once as 1st floor,
• again as 2nd-floor equivalency
Note: 200 sf of 3rd floor equivalency may be
exempted where roof pitch is 4:12 or steeper
(see "Height" section).

visual_elements.description: A cross-section diagram of a building showing two floors and an attic space, illustrating how different areas are counted for floor equivalency. The diagram is labeled 'Fig 12 2nd & 3rd floor equivalency'. It shows a '1st flr' (first floor) and a second floor. The attic space is labeled 'Inaccessible attic (or vaulted ceiling)'. Vertical measurements of 17' and 26' are indicated from the 'Top of finished floor (Typical)' to the 'Top of roof material (Typical)'. Two highlighted areas, 'A' and 'B', are shown with hatched patterns. Area A spans from the first floor up through the second floor and into the attic. Area B is a stairwell area extending from the first floor to the second floor. Text labels indicate 'Width of area that counts as 2nd-floor equivalency' and 'Width of area that counts as 3rd-floor equivalency' for portions of the attic space.
visual_elements.location: Middle to bottom of the page, left side

visual_elements.description: A second cross-section diagram of a building, similar to the first, but illustrating a 'Vaulted ceiling space' instead of a stairwell for Area B. This diagram also shows two floors and an attic space, labeled 'Inaccessible attic (or vaulted ceiling)'. Vertical measurements of 17' and 26' are indicated from the '1st fl' (first floor) to the 'Top of roof material (Typical)'. Highlighted areas 'A' and 'B' are shown with hatched patterns. Area A spans from the first floor up through the second floor and into the attic. Area B is a vaulted ceiling space extending from the first floor to the second floor. Text labels indicate 'Width of area that counts as 2nd-floor equivalency' and 'Width of area that counts as 3rd-floor equivalency' for portions of the attic space.
visual_elements.location: Middle to bottom of the page, right side
